intro: Brachyscome palustris, commonly known as swamp everlasting, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Australia. It features small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow center. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and thrives in wet or moist environments such as swampy areas and riverbanks. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Brachyscome palustris is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to stabilize soil in wet conditions.
